Protocols

The following protocols are available globally.

  • LogRecorder

    Each LogRecorder instance is responsible recording formatted log messages (along with their accompanying LogEntry instances) to an underlying log facility or data store.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol LogRecorder
  • LogConfiguration

    Defines an interface for specifying the configuration of the logging system.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol LogConfiguration
  • ColorTable

    ColorTables are used to supply foreground and background Color values for a given LogSeverity.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol ColorTable
  • LogFormatter

    LogFormatters are used to attempt to create string representations of LogEntry instances.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol LogFormatter
  • TextColorizer

    TextColorizers are used to apply color formatting to log messages.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol TextColorizer
  • LogFilter

    Before a LogEntry is recorded, any LogFilters specified in the active LogConfiguration are given a chance to prevent the entry from being recorded by returning false from the shouldRecordLogEntry() function.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol LogFilter
